byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JEFF ZELENY
byline.contributor: Ashley Parker, Jim Rutenberg and Richard A. Oppel Jr. contributed reporting.

abstract: Animosity between Republican presidential nomination rivals Mitt Romney and Texas Gov Rick Perry began long ago, set off by a series of political encounters when the they were both governors; hostilities between the two have been steadily rising and may signal a new, more combative phase in the presidential campaign.
snippet: Hostilities flaring between Mitt Romney and Gov. Rick Perry of Texas may signal a more combative phase in the Republican presidential campaign. But their conflict began years ago.
lead_paragraph: Hostilities flaring between Mitt Romney and Gov. Rick Perry of Texas may signal a more combative phase in the Republican presidential campaign. But their conflict began years ago.

headline.main: Bad Blood Between Perry and Romney Is Longstanding
headline.print_headline: 2 Republicans Share History Of Bad Blood
headline.seo: Romney and Perry Have History of Clashes
